New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder won their franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season game
Key Match Events: The Thunder trailed by 16 in the first half before pulling within 52-48 at halftime. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's team exploded for 42 third-quarter points and an 18-point lead heading into the fourth quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: James Harden was a late scratch for the Clippers.
Others: Amir Coffey led the Clippers with 26 points. Jalen Williams scored 18 points and Isaiah Hartenstein added 11 points and nine rebounds for Oklahoma City.
